articles.author: Akanksha Arora
articles.title: As Dengue Cases Double Than Last Year, Expert Weighs In On Why India Needs A Vaccine - Times Now
articles.description: This mosquito-borne viral infection, is transmitted primarily by Aedes mosquitoes, which breed in stagnant water. The spike in cases has been attributed to several factors, including climate change, rapid urbanization, and inadequate mosquito control measures.
articles.content: As Dengue Cases Double Than Last Year, Expert Weighs In On Why India Needs A Vaccine. (Image credits: iStock)
